result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Wysocki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------------

Reimburse Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit for "buy money" in the amount of $420.00.
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------------
No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No alcohol. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Take all medications as prescribed.

timeConds.notes: in the County Jail with work release to commence on or before 05/31/2016 at 8:00 a.m. If Mr. Wysocki is found NOT eligible for electronic monitoring, the Court will agree to revisit the conditional jail time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Wysocki

defendant.name: Wysocki, John R

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:34 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Atty Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft John R Wysocki in court with Atty James T Moczydlowski.    
Also present in Court are a couple of friends of Mr. Wysocki.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court understands there is an agreement on all matters except for conditional jail time.  
9:34 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Herrmann.   
9:38 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Moczydlowski.  
9:42 am  Court explains Deft may be eligible for electronic monitoring if incarcerated
9:43 am  Response by Atty Moczydlowski to Court's questions regarding Deft's health the last time he had to serve a jail sentence.
9:43 am  Response by Defendant.  
9:44 am  Response by Atty Moczydlowski to Court's question as to whether Defendants with health issues should get a free pass from any jail time?  
9:47 am  Statement by Mr. Wysocki.  
9:48 am  Statement by Jean Anderson on behalf of the Deft.  
9:50 am  Further argument by Atty Herrmann.   
9:51 am  Response by Atty Moczydlowski.  
9:41 am  Court is taking a short break to consider this matter and will resume at 10:00 am

10:02 am  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the Deft.  
Court imposes the agreed upon sentence of the parties except that the Court will not impose the fine and will impose court costs only.  
Court will impose conditional jail time.  

Sentence:  
Withheld sentence - Four (4) years probation
CONDITIONS:
Six (6) months in the County Jail with work release to commence on or before 05/31/2016 at 8:00 am
IF Mr. Wysocki is found NOT eligible for electric monitoring, the Court will agree to revisit the conditional jail time.  
Court will NOT impose a fine.  Deft to pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
Reimburse $420.00 in buy money to the Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Other counseling as recommended
No weapons.  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia .  
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  
Take all medications as prescribed.  
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

10:07 am  Court in recess.
Medical Report from Dr. Michael R. Lunde, MD.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant John R Wysocki in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John R Wysocki in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court in session at 3:12 pm. Appearances made.
Defendant in court with Attorney James T Moczydlowski. Attorney Daniel Necci appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
States calls first witness Jacob Skibba  who is duly sworn by clerk upon direct examination of Attorney Necci. State presents Exhibit#1 & #2 previously marked. State presents Exhibit #3. Court receives Exhibit #1 and Exhibits #2 & #3 to be received pending Cross examination.
3:16 pm  Cross exam by Atty Moczydlowski. 
3:25 pm  Court questions witness. Court receives Exhibit #2 & #3.
3:26 pm  Evidence closed.
3:26 pm  Argument by Attorney Necci.
3:28 pm  Court makes statement probable cause a felony has been committed. Matter bound over for trial. Information filed.  Not guilty pleas entered. Matter set over for Status Conference 11-18-2015 at 1:15.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.I. 1108 IF PERSON IS KNOWN TO DEFENDANT.

Defendant John R Wysocki in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
